pros: as a current employee i see a lot of support and training. managers are really good and reliable.
cons: maybe sometimes just the deadlines for some tasks, overall everything is very doable. sometimes clients are going to guve you a harsh time (expected from mental health) other than that, everything is good.

job_title: Community Support Worker in Rochester, NH
pros: Great experience working close with individuals in different forms of community providing them with support and encouraging them to achieve their goals
cons: I wish I got more training on specific therapeutic interventions

pros: You get to help people in need and make connections with other like minded agencies and individuals.
cons: Productivity is a big emphasis to the point we’re you focus more trying to meet numbers instead of helping individuals. Requirements are 22-23 hours a day which is doable if you sit and call around all day. But if you’re out in the community it makes it a bit difficult.

review_title: Some good people, operations need work
pros: a few really dedicated workers who really care
cons: poor communication, frequent changes, no consistency

cons: nothing that stands out at this moment

review_title: Case manager for Court Order Treatment
pros: Good helpful supervisors wiling to work with case managers
cons: Company with all the changes did not honor the hourly as originally discussed when took over specialty case load

pros: Excellent salary.   Benefits are competitive.  Some departments work well together.
cons: Office culture is cut-throat and hostile.  Management does not work and play well together.  Many departments are siloed and there is extreme lack of communication at a managerial level.  No clear understanding of the true mission of the organization and what makes that particular organization strong.  Inept management that throws each other under the bus and is reactive instead of proactive.  Poor Information Systems that are not a good resource for the business.  No opportunity for personal growth.  Fear based management style.  CEO is rather checked out and busy growing the presence in the community but misses the industry changes that impact the organization and keeps it strong.  A community presence is wonderful, but strong operations to back up that presence is just as important.

review_title: The worst place I have ever worked
pros: It was a job, that's about all I can say.  I got out as soon as I could.
cons: Management is completely self-centered and out of touch with realities of employee satisfaction and salaries. Management is a "good ol' boys" network.  Employment is based on popularity, not skill.  Opinions and suggestions (directly work related) are shot down unless they originate with management (who is woefully out of touch). I feared losing my job everyday due to the whim of any number of persons. The open hostility was shocking...fists pounding, yelling...the blame game when something did not go well.  Management never took responsibility for anything except when something went well. The line staff were always to blame, even when following the orders from management.  Salaried employees were expected to work long hours and be "on call" 24/7.  There were zero opportunities for growth.  Good employees who spoke up about company errors were fired.  The business practices were not on the "up and up".

pros: Very friendly staff. Okay wages. Clients are mostly nice.
cons: Over working the staff like most companies in this field. Sucky rules on PTO. To many top bosses and not enough lower people to actually do the work.

review_title: Turbulent, but you'll be paid well.
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Tucson, AZ
pros: Compensation and PTO are phenomenal. This is one of the highest paid behavioral health companies in Tucson, hands down.
cons: The company merges or becomes consolidated every other year. Multiple layoffs lead this to being a somewhat unstable company. Also, while the compensation is good, the benefits leave much to be desired.

pros: Nice offices at the grant location, no cubicles. Friendly coworkers. Good bosses. Good pay. Fun employee events.
cons: Business casual everyday except casual friday. They are shutting their doors at the end of September 2015.

pros: Coworkers are great.  Company's mission is good.  Overall great place to work.
cons: Budget cuts from the state affect services to clients with mental health issues.
